Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton's blast to center in the bottom of the eighth came just short of tying the game.
Austin Wells struck out with two on to end a 6-5 loss.
Juan Soto made things interesting in the bottom of the ninth with a two-out double.
The Cardinals walked Aaron Judge intentionally to bring up Austin Wells.
Wells struck out on a 3-2 slider for the final out.
Will Warren had another poor outing, placing the Yankees in a five-run hole early.
Stanton's shot to dead center hit near the top of the fence and went for a three-run double.
Matthew Liberatore gave up four straight two-out hits in the eighth.
Stanton pummeled a first-pitch slider 417 feet to center to make it 6-5.
Oswaldo Cabrera was called for a pitch clock violation and struck out to lead off the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed optimism despite the loss, highlighting the team's strong position atop the AL East.
Boone mentioned the team's grind and excitement for the final push towards October.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees head into September atop the AL East.
The Yankees are expecting reinforcements, some as soon as Sunday.
Trent Grisham played center to give Aaron Judge a partial rest as the DH.
Kyle Gibson shut down the Yankees for seven innings despite his recent struggles.
The 334-foot shot by Brendan Donovan would have been a homer only at Yankee Stadium.
